intro: Rauvolfia schuelii, commonly known as the Mexican snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its roots contain alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Rauvolfia schuelii is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
